/**

classData.comment:
/**
         * True automatically mounts a component after being rendered.
         * Use this for the top level component of your app.
         * @member {Boolean} autoMount=false
         * @tutorial 02_ClassSystem
         */
classData.description: True automatically mounts a component after being rendered. Use this for the top level component of your app.
classData.name: autoMount

classData.comment:
/**
         * True automatically renders a component after being created inside the init call.
         * Use this for the top level component of your app.
         * @member {Boolean} autoRender=false
         * @see {@link Neo.component.Base#init init}
         * @tutorial 02_ClassSystem
         */
classData.description: True automatically renders a component after being created inside the init call. Use this for the top level component of your app.
classData.name: autoRender

classData.comment:
/**
         * Internal flag for vdom changes after a component got unmounted
         * (delta updates can no longer get applied & a new render call is required before re-mounting)
         * @member {Boolean} hasUnmountedVdomChanges_=false
         * @protected
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description: Internal flag for vdom changes after a component got unmounted (delta updates can no longer get applied & a new render call is required before re-mounting)
classData.name: hasUnmountedVdomChanges_

classData.comment:
/**
         * Internal flag which will get set to true while an update request (worker messages) is in progress
         * @member {Boolean} isVdomUpdating_=false
         * @protected
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description: Internal flag which will get set to true while an update request (worker messages) is in progress
classData.name: isVdomUpdating_

classData.comment:
/**
         * True in case the component is mounted to the DOM
         * @member {Boolean} mounted_=false
         * @protected
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description: True in case the component is mounted to the DOM
classData.name: mounted_

classData.comment:
/**
         * Internal flag which will get set to true in case an update call arrives while another update is running
         * @member {Boolean} needsVdomUpdate_=false
         * @protected
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description: Internal flag which will get set to true in case an update call arrives while another update is running
classData.name: needsVdomUpdate_

classData.comment:
/**
         * True in case the component is rendering the vnode
         * @member {Boolean} rendering_=false
         * @protected
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description: True in case the component is rendering the vnode
classData.name: rendering_

classData.comment:
/**
         * Set this to true for bulk updates. Ensure to set it back to false afterwards.
         * Internally the value will get saved as a number to ensure that child methods won't stop the silent mode too early.
         * @member {Boolean} silentVdomUpdate_=false
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description: Set this to true for bulk updates. Ensure to set it back to false afterwards. Internally the value will get saved as a number to ensure that child methods won't stop the silent mode too early.
classData.name: silentVdomUpdate_

classData.comment:
/**
         * Defines the depth of the vdom tree for the next update cycle.
         * - The value 1 will only send the current vdom structure as it is
         * - The value of 2 will include the vdom of direct children
         * - The value of 3 will include the vdom of grandchildren
         * - The value of -1 will include the full tree of any depth
         * @member {Number} updateDepth_=1
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description:
Defines the depth of the vdom tree for the next update cycle.

  • The value 1 will only send the current vdom structure as it is
  • The value of 2 will include the vdom of direct children
  • The value of 3 will include the vdom of grandchildren
  • The value of -1 will include the full tree of any depth
classData.name: updateDepth_

classData.description: The component vnode tree. Available after the component got rendered.
classData.name: vnode_
classData.defaultvalue: ={[isDescriptor]: true, value: null, isEqual: (a, b) => a === b,}

classData.comment:
/**
     * Triggered after the hasUnmountedVdomChanges config got changed
     * @param {Boolean} value
     * @param {Boolean} oldValue
     * @protected
     */
classData.description: Triggered after the hasUnmountedVdomChanges config got changed
classData.name: afterSetHasUnmountedVdomChanges

classData.comment:
/**
     * Triggered after the vdom pseudo-config got changed
     * @param {Object} value
     * @param {Object|null} oldValue
     * @protected
     */
classData.description: Triggered after the vdom pseudo-config got changed
classData.name: afterSetVdom

classData.comment:
/**
     * Triggered after the vnode config got changed
     * @param {Object} value

     * @protected

classData.description: Triggered after the vnode config got changed
classData.name: afterSetVnode

classData.comment:
/**
     * Creates a lightweight, serializable placeholder for this component, intended for injection
     * into the VDOM of other components.
     *
     * This is the **only recommended way** to nest a component within another component's VDOM tree.
     * Directly embedding one component's full `vdom` object into another's is an anti-pattern
     * that violates the principle of scoped VDOM, leading to unpredictable rendering behavior
     * and making updates inefficient.
     *
     * At its core, the returned object contains a `componentId` that uniquely identifies the
     * component instance. In cases where a component's structure is wrapped by another element
     * (e.g., a Button in a Table Header being wrapped by a `<td>`), the reference will also
     * include the wrapper's `id`. This happens when a component uses `getVdomRoot()` to
     * designate a deeper node as its logical root, causing the component's `id` and its
     * VDOM root's `id` to differ. The framework uses this dual-ID reference to correctly
     * assemble the final VDOM tree.
     *
     * @returns {{componentId: String, id: String|undefined}} The VDOM reference object.
     */
classData.description:
Creates a lightweight, serializable placeholder for this component, intended for injection into the VDOM of other components.

This is the only recommended way to nest a component within another component's VDOM tree. Directly embedding one component's full vdom object into another's is an anti-pattern that violates the principle of scoped VDOM, leading to unpredictable rendering behavior and making updates inefficient.

At its core, the returned object contains a componentId that uniquely identifies the component instance. In cases where a component's structure is wrapped by another element (e.g., a Button in a Table Header being wrapped by a <td>), the reference will also include the wrapper's id. This happens when a component uses getVdomRoot() to designate a deeper node as its logical root, causing the component's id and its VDOM root's id to differ. The framework uses this dual-ID reference to correctly assemble the final VDOM tree.
classData.name: createVdomReference

classData.comment:
/**
     * Internal method to send update requests to the vdom worker
     * @param {function} [resolve] used by promiseUpdate()
     * @param {function} [reject] used by promiseUpdate()
     * @private
     */
classData.description: Internal method to send update requests to the vdom worker
classData.name: executeVdomUpdate

classData.description: Honors different item roots for mount / render OPs

classData.description: Search a vdom child node by id for a given vdom tree

classData.comment:
/**
     * Specify a different vdom root if needed to apply the top level style attributes on a different level.
     * Make sure to use getVnodeRoot() as well, to keep the vdom & vnode trees in sync.
     * @returns {Object} The new vdom root
     */
classData.description: Specify a different vdom root if needed to apply the top level style attributes on a different level. Make sure to use getVnodeRoot() as well, to keep the vdom & vnode trees in sync.
classData.name: getVdomRoot

classData.comment:
/**
     * Specify a different vnode root if needed to apply the top level style attributes on a different level.
     * Make sure to use getVdomRoot() as well, to keep the vdom & vnode trees in sync.
     * @returns {Object} The new vnode root
     */
classData.description: Specify a different vnode root if needed to apply the top level style attributes on a different level. Make sure to use getVdomRoot() as well, to keep the vdom & vnode trees in sync.
classData.name: getVnodeRoot

classData.description: Checks if a given updateDepth & distance would result in an update collision
classData.name: hasUpdateCollision

classData.comment:
/**
     * Checks for vdom updates inside the parent chain and if found.
     * Registers the component for a vdom update once done.
     * @param {String} parentId=this.parentId
     * @param {Function} [resolve] Gets passed by updateVdom()
     * @param {Number} distance=1 Distance inside the component tree
     * @returns {Boolean}
     */
classData.description: Checks for vdom updates inside the parent chain and if found. Registers the component for a vdom update once done.
classData.name: isParentUpdating

classData.comment:
/**
     * Checks the needsVdomUpdate config inside the parent tree
     * @param {String} parentId=this.parentId
     * @param {Function} [resolve] gets passed by updateVdom()
     * @param {Number} distance=1 Distance inside the component tree
     * @returns {Boolean}
     */
classData.description: Checks the needsVdomUpdate config inside the parent tree
classData.name: mergeIntoParentUpdate

classData.comment:
/**
     * Gets called from the render() promise success handler
     * @param {Object} vnode
     * @param {Boolean} autoMount Mount the DOM after the vnode got created
     * @protected
     */
classData.description: Gets called from the render() promise success handler

params.description: Mount the DOM after the vnode got created
params.name: autoMount

classData.name: onRender

classData.description: Promise based vdom update
classData.name: promiseUpdate

classData.comment:
/**
     * Creates the vnode tree for this component and mounts the component in case
     * - you pass true for the mount param
     * - or the autoMount config is set to true
     * @param {Boolean} [mount] Mount the DOM after the vnode got created
     * @returns {Promise<any>} If getting there, we return the data from vdom.Helper: create(), containing the vnode.
     */
classData.description:
Creates the vnode tree for this component and mounts the component in case

  • you pass true for the mount param
  • or the autoMount config is set to true

params.description: Mount the DOM after the vnode got created
params.name: mount

returns.description: If getting there, we return the data from vdom.Helper: create(), containing the vnode.

classData.name: render

classData.comment:
/**
     * Internal helper fn to resolve the Promise for updateVdom()
     * @param {Object}   [data] The return value of vdom.Helper.update()
     * @protected
     */
classData.description: Internal helper fn to resolve the Promise for updateVdom()
classData.name: resolveVdomUpdate

classData.comment:
/**
     * Placeholder method for util.VDom.syncVdomIds to allow overriding (disabling) it
     * @param {Neo.vdom.VNode} [vnode=this.vnode]
     * @param {Object} [vdom=this.vdom]
     * @param {Boolean} force=false
     */
classData.description: Placeholder method for util.VDom.syncVdomIds to allow overriding (disabling) it
classData.name: syncVdomIds

classData.comment:
/**
     * In case a component receives a new vnode, we want to do:
     * - sync the vdom ids
     * - setting rendered to true for child components
     * - updating the parent component to ensure that the vnode tree stays persistent
     * @param {Neo.vdom.VNode} [vnode=this.vnode]
     */
classData.description:
In case a component receives a new vnode, we want to do:

  • sync the vdom ids
  • setting rendered to true for child components
  • updating the parent component to ensure that the vnode tree stays persistent
classData.name: syncVnodeTree

classData.comment:
/**
     * Gets called after the vdom config gets changed in case the component is already mounted (delta updates).
     * @param {function} [resolve] used by promiseUpdate()
     * @param {function} [reject] used by promiseUpdate()
     * @protected
     */
classData.description: Gets called after the vdom config gets changed in case the component is already mounted (delta updates).
classData.name: updateVdom
